creator: garrel@more.net
text:
According to the JSP 1.2 specification, JSP include directives should use a 
relative path. Tomcat4 beta 5 doesn't appear to be using relative paths. This 
is not a problem in Tomcat 3.2 beta4. 

Example
If I have the following directory and file structure:

root\
  index.jsp
  file1.jsp
root\dir1\
  index.jsp
  file1.jsp

index.jsp in both the root and dir1 directories includes file1.jsp like this:

<%@ include file="file1.jsp" %>

Currently, file1.jsp from root\ is included in root\dir1\index.jsp. Instead, 
root\dir1\file1.jsp should be included unless I specifically point to file1.jsp 
in the root like the following:

<%@ include file="\root\file1.jsp" %>

New Information

This defect is more complex than I initially thought. The problem that I see is 
replicated when you include a file, and the included file includes another 
file. Otherwise, the defect is not displayed. My original defect report does 
not take this into consideration, and testing under the circumstances that I 
described will not display the defect.

To see the defect, create this hierarchy of directories and files:
root_directory_of_webapp\
 test2.html
dir1\
 test.jsp
 test1.jsp
 test2.html

In test.jsp, use the include directive to include test1.jsp. 
In test1.jsp, use the include directive to include test2.html like this:

<%@ include file="test2.html" %>

When you view test.jsp, you will see the contents of test2.html from the root 
directory. However, if you specify file="/dir1/test2.html", it is included 
properly. 

For some reason, the second include doesn't use the relative path.
